data.title: Preview for tables in markdown files is incorrect
data.body: - VSCode Version: Code 1.15.1 (41abd21afdf7424c89319ee7cb0445cc6f376959, 2017-08-16T17:15:57.756Z) - OS Version: Darwin x64 16.7.0 - Extensions: Extension|Author (truncated)|Version ---|---|--- vscode-docker|Pet|0.0.16 vscode-eslint|dba|1.2.11 tslint|eg2|0.17.0 Go|luk|0.6.63 debugger-for-chrome|msj|3.2.0 java|red|0.8.0 --- Markdown preview broken for tables. Steps to Reproduce: 1. Create a markdown file with following contents. Note: there are 3 spaces before start of table. ``` Heading ======= |Word |Vowel Count| |------|----------| |Rhythm|0 | |Mingle|2 | ``` 2. The preview for the file does not show the first column in the table. If there are no spaces included before the start of table pipe, the preview of table is rendered correctly. Whereas if there are spaces, the table rendering is broken. The contents of the first column is pushed to second column. Reproduces without extensions: Yes

data.title: Extension Host Restart doesn't close messages from previously crashed extension host
data.body:
Testing #33300 

- I had an extension host crash after an error

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/172399/29815745-03285b60-8cb2-11e7-8ed6-9fbe51182b10.png)

- I executed Restart Extension Host. 

I ended up in this state

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/172399/29815906-928fc112-8cb2-11e7-9962-9e487727a390.png)


Suggest to close the messages, since with the message box visible it is not clear to me when the extension host restart is done.

data.title: ResolveDebugConfiguration not called in no folder case
Word wrap and punctuation
data.body:
Versions:

- VSCode Version: 1.15.1 (commit 41abd21afdf7424c89319ee7cb0445cc6f376959)
- OS Version: `Linux version 4.10.0-32-generic (buildd@lcy01-01) (gcc version 5.4.0 20160609 (Ubuntu 5.4.0-6ubuntu1~16.04.4) ) #36~16.04.1-Ubuntu SMP Wed Aug 9 09:19:02 UTC 2017`

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open new file.
2. Type normal text (with spaces, eg `chick en`) until word wrap is reached, **the last character on the line should be a letter [a-z], and it should be AT the word-wrap length**. That is, if the cursor is right past the last letter, the column number should be equal to `editor.wordWrapColumn`.
3. Now add a comma `,`; the comma is not wrapped, despite the fact that it is past the last column. This is great, and not necessarily unexpected to treat punctuation specially.
4. Remove the comma, and instead type `),`: now the comma is wrapped but not the parenthesis. This is unexpected; I would either expect both not to be wrapped, or else the entire word with punctuation to be wrapped.

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Yes

---

I think that punctuation should either:

 - not be wrapped for up to 2 chars beyond `editor.wordWrapColumn` (eg to allow things like `last word).` or `last word),`); 
 - or that the entire word with punctuation should be wrapped together instead of just the punctuation (eg `word).` should be wrapped instead of just `.` presently).

It also seems that commas `,` have a special treatment with regards to word wrapping. So the simplest might be either to remove this special treatment, or include parentheses and brackets to it.

data.title: Clarify in docs what should happen if more than one provider is registered for the same type
data.body:
Refs: #33248

Currently from api comments it is not clear what is expected to happen if multiple providers are registered for the same type. It simply says this is allowed. I suggest to mention that all configurations will get merged

![screen shot 2017-08-29 at 11 46 28](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1926584/29815136-e5adea16-8caf-11e7-8b28-b4f428eea3b6.png)

data.title: SCM: Explore master-detail view
data.body:
From @sqs

> Would you be interested in a PR that implemented a UI like this? I just hacked this together tonight.
> 
> The Open Repositories section works like the Open Editors section; it grows (to a point) based on the number of open repositories. Selecting a repository shows that repository's (and only that repository's) SourceControlView in the rest of the viewlet. Focus is in the Open Repositories list initially.
> 
> It would be fairly easy to make it possible to show multiple repositories' SourceControlViews if you multi-selected them. That would of course be duplicating some functionality of a viewlet's subviews (e.g., you could make it so right-clicking on the Source Control header would let you check/uncheck each repo, as in the extensions viewlet), but it seems quite convenient to make this always visible.
> 
> ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1976/29813975-99e7a454-8c60-11e7-8de8-3502a4f6fbd1.png)

data.title: name should not be optional for DebugConfiguration
data.body:
Refs: #33248

`name` should be mandatory for `DebugConfiguration` since if it is left out by the `DebugConfigurationProvider` the `launch.json` will show an error in json since `name` is mandatory in the `launch.json` schema.

![screen shot 2017-08-29 at 11 39 35](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1926584/29814775-d195110e-8cae-11e7-9b50-398577736a47.png)

data.title: Debug breakpoint not showing as resolved nor hit in multi root workspace
data.body:
Steps to Reproduce (macOS):

1. generate an extension and open it as folder and debug a little bit (add breakpoints)
2. generate another extension and drop this folder into the explorer to create a multi root workspace
3. add a breakpoint into the second extension (it shows up as unresolved for me)
4. start the extension and make sure the breakpoint code is executed
5. the breakpoint now turns into a resolved breakpoint but only the second invocation makes it stop there

This seems multi-root workspace related?

data.title: Smooth scrolling isn't so smooth when jumping long distances
data.body:
re #33299

* open a very large file, e.g `checker.ts` from the TypeScript repo
* be on the first line
* open quick outline and scroll down to the last entry in its list and select it (don't select other items in the list)
* the smooth scrolling visually stales a few times

data.title: [theming] set foreground of 'Open Changes', 'Replace' and 'Replace All' icons

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.15.1 (41abd21afdf7424c89319ee7cb0445cc6f376959, 2017-08-16T17:15:57.756Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.7.0
- Extensions: 
Extension|Author (truncated)|Version
---|---|---
asciidecorator|hel|0.2.0
vscode-icon-theme|jtl|1.5.0
cpptools|ms-|0.12.3
wordcount|ms-|0.1.0
color-highlight|nau|2.3.0
spellchecker|swy|1.2.13

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open a file in the editor.
2. Observe that the Open Changes, Replace and Replace All icons all contain some blue foreground portions that, as far as I can tell, cannot be modified. 

It would be nice if users could specify the foreground color of these icons, rather than just using the standard-issue little bit of blue foreground alongside the white foreground in the icons. A single color instead of two colors would be perfectly fine to modify the foreground of these icons, just like the Open Preview to the Side and Split Editor icons, in order to further enhance users' color themes.

Reproduces without extensions: Yes

- debug TypeScript hello world extension
- press "F5" and wait until EH appears
- press "Restart"

![2017-08-29_11-00-40](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1898161/29813229-cddcdf24-8ca9-11e7-9b9d-d4d83c00ad64.png)

```
******** Unhandled error in debug adapter: Error: not opened
    at LoggingSocket.send (c:\Program Files\Microsoft VS Code Insiders\resources\app\extensions\ms-vscode.node-debug2\node_modules\ws\lib\WebSocket.js:219:16)

    at LoggingSocket.Client.socket.on (c:\Program Files\Microsoft VS Code Insiders\resources\app\extensions\ms-vscode.node-debug2\node_modules\noice-json-rpc\lib\noice-json-rpc.js:25:18)
    at emitNone (events.js:86:13)
```

This is reproducible in 90% of the time.
In 10% I don't see the error but then I run into #32545
